Quick search

User Functions¶

class api.user.User(base_url, session, token)¶

A collection of functions to deal with user accounts.

create_user(username, password, first_name, last_name, email, title='', dept='', notes='Add Via API', admin_role='', app_role='analytics_developer', emails=False)¶

Create a user account with specified parameters.

Parameters:
  • username (string) – A unique name.
  • password (string) – Password of the user being created.
  • first_name (string) – First Name of the user being created.
  • last_name (string) – Last Name of the user being created.
  • email (string) – Email of the user being created.
  • title (string) – User Title of the user being created.
  • dept (string) – Department of the user being created.
  • notes (string) – Note for the user being created.
  • admin_role (string) – Administration role. One of app_admin, data_admin or an empty string.
  • app_role (string) – Application role. One of analytics_developer, data_analyst, collaborator or business_user.
  • emails (bool) – Option of subscribe to emails.
Returns:

API response
Return type:

dict
delete_user(user_name)¶

Delete the user with no error checking.

Parameters:user_name – (string, required) Username of account to be deleted
Returns:Response of the delete action.
delete_user_if_exists(user_name)¶

Delete the User if the user exists or skip without throwing any error if user doesn’t exists

Parameters:user_name – Username of the user to be deleted
Returns:Response of the delete action.
get_user_data(user_name)¶

Get one user’s metadata

Parameters:user_name (string) – The unique user name
Returns:User data
Return type:dict
get_user_id(user_name)¶

Gets the ID number of the user.

Parameters:user_name (string) – User name of the user to query on
Returns:ID number of the user
Return type:int
get_users_data_list(per_page=100)¶

Get a list of all users’ metadata.

Parameters:per_page (int) – How many users to return in each page
Returns:A list of user data
Return type:list of dict
update_user_data(user_name, first_name=None, last_name=None, email=None, title=None, dept=None, notes=None, admin=None, user_type=None)¶

Updating for user information

Parameters:
  • user_name – Username of the user to be updated
  • first_name – Updated First Name of the user
  • last_name – Updated Last Name of the user
  • email – Updated Email of the user
  • title – Updated Title of the user
  • dept – Updated Department of the user
  • notes – Updated Notes of the user
  • admin – Updated Admin of the user
  • user_type – Updated User Type of the user
Returns:

Information of the updated user
Return type:

dict
